TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Supply, Delivery and Commissioning of a Solar Power Plant in Diaramana Village, Mali

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: This contract requires a 75 kWp solar photovoltaic (PV) power plant to be purchased, delivered, installed, tested and integrated with a generator (to be supplied by others) that will be interconnected into a mini-grid in Diaramana village, Mali. The project will connect 300 households, businesses and community centres. See the technical specifications in the complete tender dossier for further information.
30 days after signature of the contract for the first batch (of 2).
90 days after signature of the contract for the second batch.
ACP-EC Partnership Agreement signed at Cotonou on 23.6.2000 as amended on 25.6.2005 and on 22.6.2010 (Annex IV).

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: This contract requires a 75 kWp solar photovoltaic (PV) power plant to be purchased, delivered, installed, tested and integrated with a generator (to be supplied by others) that will be interconnected into a mini-grid in Diaramana village, Mali.

DEPOSITS_GUARANTEES_REQUIRED.P: Tenderers must provide a tender guarantee of EUR 6 000 when submitting their tender. This guarantee will be released to unsuccessful tenderers once the tender procedure has been completed and to the successful tenderer(s) upon signature of the contract by all parties. This guarantee will be called upon if the tenderer does not fulfil all obligations stated in its tender.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: The successful tenderer will be asked to provide a performance guarantee of 10 % of the amount of the contract at the signing of the contract. This guarantee must be provided no later than 30 days after the tenderer receives the contract signed by the Contracting Authority. If the selected tenderer fails to provide such a guarantee within this period, the contract will be void and a new contract may be drawn up and sent to the tenderer which has submitted the next best compliant tender.

LEGAL_FORM.P: The successful tenderer will be asked to provide a performance guarantee of 10 % of the amount of the contract at the signing of the contract. If the selected tenderer fails to provide such a guarantee within this period, the contract will be void and a new contract may be drawn up and sent to the tenderer which has submitted the next best compliant tender.

CRITERIA_DEFINITION.CRITERIA: Quality, lifetime and suitability of equipment

PLACE_NOT_STRUCTURED.P: FRES – Foundation Rural Energy Services, Amstel 49, 1011 PW Amsterdam, The Netherlands

EXISTENCE_AUTHORISED_PERSONS.P: All tenders must be received before the deadline date and time on 7 March 2018 at 11:00 CET (Central European Time). Any tender received after this deadline will not be considered.
The tenders will be opened in public session on 9 March 2018 at 13:00 CET in Amsterdam.

RELATES_TO_EU_PROJECT_YES.P: Financed through European Commission’s ACP-EU Facility Energy 10th European Development Fund.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: The tender dossier is available from the Contracting Authority via the email address provided below. Tenders must be submitted using the standard tender form included in the tender dossier, whose format and instructions must be strictly observed.

Tenderers with questions regarding this tender should send them in writing to the following email address, procurement_regional@fres.nl.
Specifying the publication reference and the contract title by 14 February 2018.
The Contracting Authority must reply to all tenderers' questions by 21 February 2018.
The selection and award criteria are carried out in three phases:
The first phase is an administrative check to ensure all required documentation has been submitted.
The second phase is a check into the following:
— Previous relevant experience in supplying and installing autonomous off-grid photovoltaic plants in Africa or the developing world. A minimum of three contactable references are requested,
— Experience of the individuals who will be ultimately responsible for the delivery of the project,
— Nature of client references,
— Financial health of the supplier,
— Timelines committed for the commissioning of the solar power plant,
— Provision for training and supervision.
The third phase is a detailed evaluation of the most cost-effective tender, in line with the award criteria defined below.
NB:
Phases one and two of the selection process will take place during the tender opening session. Phase three will be carried out external to the tender opening session in the subsequent days.
Proposals not meeting all the requirements of one phase may be eliminated before proceeding to the next phase.
Proposals not meeting all the requirements as detailed in the technical specifications document may be eliminated.
The contract must be awarded to the most cost-effective tender (i.e., the tender offering the best price-quality ratio).
— Price: 30 %,
— Quality, lifetime and suitability of equipment: 30 %,
— Technical approach: 30 %,
— Warranties provided on components: 10 %.
